title: Giza ?
content:
Hello,

I'm working on an brand identity for a manufacturer of designy modern furniture.

At first, I was thinking of something explicitly design & modern.  
Maybe some kind of gotham thin, or a klavika, maybe even engel.

But I wanted to add strength to the brand.

I fell on Giza.

I love the great impact of this face, but now I'm stuck in the choice a typeface to go with it in the body copy, and I feel Giza would be difficult in a daily use.

I 'd love to share your thoughts

thanks in advance

+
author: laurent

comments.content:
I'm a Giza fan, too. Nick Shinn's [Figgins](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021145229/http:/shinntype.com/) is based on the sans-serif font that Figgins (on whose Egyptian David Berlow based Giza) brought out, so that could be sympathetic or even be used instead of Giza. It's not out yet, but I believe it will be soon -- e-mail Nick if you're interested.

In the same vein as Figgins, I think a slightly idiosyncratic and 19th-century-feeling sans or serif might work nicely. [DynaGrotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021145229/http:/stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/families-55-dynagrotesk), [Maple](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021145229/http:/processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/maple/index.html), [National Grotesque](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021145229/http:/www.klim.co.nz/national_samples.php) (soon-to-be-released), and [Parry and Parry Grotesque](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021145229/http:/ourtype.be/) could be some really nice possibilities. And [FF Bau](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021145229/http:/christianschwartz.com/bau.shtml) would be a 20th-century-style alternative.

Great recommendations, Reed. All of those would play very well with Giza.

Since you're using a 19th-century face for the logo you might want to consider using something more modern to reflect the product. Perhaps a grotesque sans (like FF Bau) would be best. Or maybe [Maquette](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021145229/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/arstype/maquette/), [Region](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021145229/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/arstype/region/), or [Proxima Nova](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021145229/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/mark_simonson/proxima_nova_ot/). Perhaps a modern gothic like [Scopex](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021145229/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/primetype/ptl_skopex_gothic_complete_ot/).

Maple is just great, but I think it's too special for the job.  
I feel I need as nice good looking discrete font.

I've bought FF Bau a few months ago for another project,  
I must admit I would never have thought of using it here.

I shall give it a try

thanks for the quality of your answers

+

Thanks for the mention of Figgins, Reed. I saw the pdf of Modern Suite that Nick has on his site and it is beautiful.

Sharon

How about Giza for Headings and Griffith Gothic for Body Copy?  
Critiques appreciated.
